headline: Walker declines to say if he backed Perdue or Kemp in Ga. gubernatorial primary
author: Caroline Vakil
sentences: Walker also struck a message of unity when he was asked if he wanted to stump with former President Trump should he win the Republican primary in the Georgia Senate race.
Kemps campaign confirmed to The Hill earlier this month that Marc Short, former chief of staff to Pence, had joined Kemps campaign team.
Georgia Senate candidate Herschel Walker (R) declined to say on Tuesday if he voted for former Sen. David Perdue (R) or incumbent Gov.
In February, Walker was asked whom he supported in Georgias gubernatorial race, responding, I dont support either one of them.
Ive known Sen. Perdue since I was 19, and this is what I want to say to everyone here: I want to bring this party together.
The Hill has removed its comment section, as there are many other forums for readers to participate in the conversation.
If he wants to come down, I told him he and his family could come down, Walker said, according to the news outlet.

I want all Republicans to come down and campaign for me, because weve got to bring this party together.
Whoever wins, Im going to get behind him, Walker said, according to The Atlanta Journal-Constitution.
Walkers comments come amid a GOP Georgia primary that has divided some high-profile Republicans.
